variant.question: What is correct regarding the effect of displacement drag and impingement drag on take-off performance? There is a (1) \_\_\_\_\_ effect in case of a rejected take-off and a (2) \_\_\_\_\_ effect for continued take-off.

options.text: (1) positive; (2) positive
(1) positive; (2) negative
(1) negative; (2) positive
(1) negative; (2) negative

variant.question: Which aircraft design would be the most sensitive to changes in airflow patterns when entering ground effect?

options.text: A high-wing aircraft with a low-mounted tailplane.
A low-wing aircraft with a high-mounted tailplane.
A low-wing aircraft with a low-mounted tailplane.
A high-wing aircraft with a high-mounted tailplane.

variant.question: When landing an aircraft at an airfield during a hot day, the increased temperature of the runway will:

options.text: Subtrcact from the consequences of entering ground effect.
Add to the consequences of leaving ground effect.
Add to the consequences of entering ground effect.
Have no effect on the consequences of ground effect.

variant.question: A low wing aircraft entering the ground effect during the landing phase will experience...

options.text: an increase in induced drag.
a nose-down pitching moment and tendency to float.
an increase in wing-tip vortices.
a reduction in interference drag and tendency to float.

variant.question: During the landing phase of flight, an aeroplane entering ground effect with a constant angle of attack will...

options.text: indicate a higher airspeed and require more rudder for directional control.
experience an increase in coefficient of lift and have a tendency to float.
require a gradual increase in the required thrust in order to avoid a hard landing.
experience an increase in induced drag and have a tendency to land short.

variant.question: An aeroplane leaving the ground effect after take-off will experience...

options.text: an increase in induced drag.
a reduction in wing-tip vortices.
a nose-down pitching moment.
an increase in form drag.

variant.question: An large jet transport aeroplane has the following four flap positions: Up, Take-off, Approach and Landing and two slat positions: Retracted and Extended. Generally speaking, the selection that provides the highest positive contribution to CLMAX is:

options.text: flaps from Take-off to Approach.
flaps from Up to Take-off.
slats from Retracted to Extended.
flaps from Approach to Landing.
